title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1270.2 - Permission to use terminal conditional
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1270.2 - Permission to use terminal conditional

State Regulations

Any permission granted directly or indirectly, expressly
or by implication, to any person or persons, to enter upon or use the air
terminal or any part thereof (including aircraft operators, crew members and
passengers, spectators, sightseers, pleasure and commercial vehicles, officers
and employees of lessees, and other persons occupying space at the air
terminal, persons doing business with the airport operator, its subcontractors
and permittees, and all other persons whatsoever whether or not of the type
indicated), is conditioned upon compliance with the rules and regulations set
forth in this Article and entry upon or into the air terminal by any person
shall be deemed to constitute an agreement by such person to comply with said
rules and regulations; provided, however, that any specific rule or regulation
will not apply to a user of the air terminal if the agreement between such user
and the airport operator so provides and the Port Authority has given its
express written consent to the waiver of said rules and
regulations. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1270.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
